tv.generator-info-name: Processed by Open-EPG Visual Processor v1.0

programme.title: Rage New Music
programme.desc: Discover the wildest new music videos on rage. Essential grooves and boundary-pushing visuals from Australia and beyond.

programme.title: Rage Charts
programme.desc: Count down the hottest chart hits, and catch up on some of the most promising new popular music videos on rage.

programme.title: Rage
programme.desc: Keep the party vibe going every Saturday morning with wall-to-wall music videos, from classic hits and long-forgotten tracks from the rage vault, to the latest new releases and special features.

programme.title: ABC News At Noon
programme.desc: Melissa Mackay presents the latest from ABC News on the weekend bringing you todays top stories and coverage of events as they unfold. Plus original reporting, analysis and updated news, sport, weather and information.

programme.title: Maigret
programme.desc: Maigret must choose between his sense of justice and his career when a burglar is found murdered.

programme.title: I Was Actually There
programme.desc: On a hot December day, racial tensions boiled over at Sydneys Cronulla beach. The fuse had been lit a week earlier by an altercation between off-duty lifesavers and men described by police as "of middle eastern appearance".

programme.title: Return To Paradise
programme.desc: When crabby Vince Ogden is found dead in his locked bedsit, its up to Mackenzie to shine a light on the truth of his murder. (Final)

programme.title: rage Guest Programmer: Hatchie
programme.desc: Join Brisbane indie dream-pop darling Hatchie as she guests programs rage with an influence-spanning mix of millennium-pop, alt-rock, electro and post-punk.

programme.title: Rage
programme.desc: Keep the party vibe going with wall-to-wall music videos, from new releases to classics and the long-forgotten.

programme.title: Insiders
programme.desc: David Speers discusses the week in politics with Patricia Karvelas, John Kehoe and Jason Koutsoukis including pressure on Sussan Leys leadership, the Liberals position on net zero, plus environment reforms and house prices.

programme.title: The World This Week
programme.desc: Girish Sawlani presents a roundup of the weeks big stories: Democratic socialist Zohran Mamdani elected mayor of New York City, fighting intensifies in the Ukrainian city of Pokrovsk, and David Beckham receives a knighthood.

programme.title: Songs Of Praise: Young Chorister Of The Year - Junior Semi-final
programme.desc: Aled Jones presents the Junior Semi-Final of BBC Young Chorister Of The Year from The Monastery in Manchester with judges Laura Wright, Ken Burton and Wynne Evans.

programme.title: Gardening Australia
programme.sub-title: Spring: Mediterranean Living and Super Soil
programme.desc: Costa supercharges vegie soil, Jane explores a cemetery enlivened with wildflowers, Josh finds a tranquil Mediterranean courtyard, Tammy gets advice on growing desert peas, and we meet a sculptor creating lifelike plants.

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Ann Melbourne found her birth mother but a relationship did not develop. But this hasnt stopped Ann wanting to find her birth father. Meanwhile, professional dancer Amanda Village is on the trail of her mother, Susan.

programme.title: Grand Designs Australia
programme.desc: Acclaimed Australian architect Ed Lippmann discovers transforming his childhood home into a signature steel and glass showpiece may be the most daunting assignment of his storied career.

programme.title: Portrait Artist Of The Year
programme.desc: Nine artists have 4 hours to create portraits of Drag Queen Courtney Act, Actor Mark Coles Smith and film critic Margaret Pomeranz, each with a personal item. The judges select a top 3, and 1 advances to the semi-final.

programme.title: Good Game Spawn Point
programme.sub-title: Spacelines From The Far Out And Character Creator Challenge
programme.desc: We run our own spaceshuttle service in our review of the interstellar chaos of Spacelines From The Far Out, plus we try to recreate iconic characters in Challenge Accepted!

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: Boudica turns against her Roman masters and unleashes her Wrecking Ball on Colchester, St Albans and London. We also meet famous Emperors Caligula and Nero, dishing out their unique brand of Imperial nastiness.

programme.title: Star Wars: Young Jedi Adventures
programme.desc: Raxlo and his harvester are recruited for a rescue mission.

programme.title: Hard Quiz Kids
programme.sub-title: The Listies, Homers The Odyssey, My Chemical Romance and Orangutans
programme.desc: Four young know-it-alls try to get their hands on Tom Gleesons Big Brass Mug, but which eclectic topic will win the day: The Listies, Homers The Odyssey, My Chemical Romance, or orangutans?

programme.title: Abbott Elementary
programme.desc: With the school board threatening to pull their funds, Janine and Gregory decide to help Ava out with her presentation.

programme.title: Pokemon: Diamond And Pearl
programme.desc: Our heroes, along with treasure-hunter Cheryl, discover a mysterious cave that might hold the answers to the Enchanted Honey theyve been looking for!

programme.title: Operation Ouch!: Do Try This At Home
programme.desc: Dr Chris and Dr Xand have brought their lab into Xands kitchen! In todays episode, the doctors look at lungs, and show you an experiment to measure how much air they can hold.

programme.title: Good Game Spawn Point
programme.sub-title: Lego Star Wars: The Skywalker Saga And Lego Dc Super Villians!
programme.desc: We review two giant LEGO games with LEGO Star Wars: The Skywalker Saga, and LEGO DC Super Villians! Plus, we take you on a tour of our personal dens of gaming!

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: Join the doctors as they revisit Ouchers from across the last 7 series, including Matthew who had a cochlear implant enabling him to hear and Ouch Patient Ruby whos recovered from Leukaemia.

programme.title: Star Wars: Young Jedi Adventures
programme.desc: Nashs racing hero needs her help.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: A wayward balloonist lands in the sheep field. Shaun and his friends are intrigued by the hot air balloon and inadvertently take to the skies.

programme.title: Crongton
programme.desc: Liccle hides a package for Manjaro before deciding to dispose of it to protect everyone.

programme.title: Abbott Elementary
programme.desc: Janine is out sick for the day; Ava must step in herself to help out.

programme.title: Secrets Of The Zoo
programme.desc: This week at the Columbus Zoo, we meet an adorable baby Rhino, witness an amazing polar bear birth, and comfort a rare bird named Marla.

programme.title: Penn And Teller: Fool Us
programme.sub-title: I Now Pronounce You Magic and Wife
programme.desc: Featured magicians include Paco Agrado, The Cosmic Romantics, Kingsley Xu and Damien Dubi.

programme.title: ABC News Update
programme.desc: The headlines from ABC News, updating you on the days top stories from across Australia and around the world.

programme.title: A Kind Of Spark
programme.desc: Addie and Audreys friendship blossoms as they go door to door to spread the word about Junipers witches. Maggie starts a secret rebellion putting her at odds with Elinor.

programme.title: 100% Wolf: Legend Of The Moonstone
programme.desc: The real Beatrice Beefcheek arrives at Howlington, and Batty is exposed - and expelled! Freddy has to bring Batty back, figure out how to convince Pincus to let her stay, and avoid a wilderwolf who seems to be after him!

programme.title: My Family: The Heart Of Christmas
programme.desc: Ben isnt looking forward to Christmas and tries to convince Susan of a mystery illness in an effort to escape the festive season. Susan calls his bluff and drags him to the doctors, only for Ben to be admitted into hospital.

programme.title: Jonestown: Terror In The Jungle
programme.desc: A heroic congressman travels to Jonestown; Temple members plot their escape. Jim Jones realises the walls are closing in and plans his final stand.

programme.title: A Kind Of Spark
programme.desc: A trip to the big city leads to a shocking discovery about Maggies disappearance. Nina and Keedie build a shaky truce whilst party shopping.

programme.title: 100% Wolf: Legend Of The Moonstone
programme.desc: When the wilderwolf hunting Freddy is exposed as Cherry, and sentenced to be defanged for her crimes, Freddy tries to prove that she can be reformed. Scarlet meets two other young wolfhunters who take a different approach.

programme.title: The Strange Chores
programme.desc: Charlies stuck walking Wolfman instead of going to a party. He irresponsibly ditches Wolfman, but a little scratch on his neck could spell disaster.

programme.title: Malory Towers
programme.desc: Celeste tries to get herself expelled so she will be sent home, by creating chaos with garden snails when Mary-Lou takes the Third Form art class.

programme.title: ER
programme.desc: Carter is late for duty when victims of a gang shootout are brought into ER. A group of third year medical students arrives as a new Chief Resident is chosen. Carol treats a man after he is found drowning in his own vomit.

programme.title: Louis Theroux: Under The Knife
programme.desc: Louis Theroux reveals the startling reality of a sweeping obsession with vanity - plastic surgery. Can larger breasts or tighter abs really make a person happier?

programme.title: ER
programme.desc: While Kerry Weaver offends just about everyone on her first day as Chief Resident, Ross deals with a young pyromaniac, Hathaway rides ambulance duty with a handsome paramedic, and Carter shows interest in a new med student.

programme.title: In The Night Garden
programme.desc: Travelling in the Pinky Ponk, the Tombliboos are drinking their Pinky Ponk juice.

programme.title: Hoopla Doopla!
programme.desc: Mimi decides to make an extra large pizza for everyone in Hoopla, but when she tosses the sticky pizza dough high in the air in lands all over her. The others mistake her for a monster, a dough monster.

programme.title: Daniel Tigers Neighbourhood
programme.desc: Daniel is SO excited for the new Tigey the Adventure Tiger book to come out, but before he can get it, he has to go to Dr. Plats office. Waiting can be hard, but playing and imagining make the waiting go faster.

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Charlie is coming to play and Bing has planned lots of things for them to do. But when Charlie arrives he doesnt want to play any of the games Bing has put out.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Its Daddy Pigs birthday but he still has to go to work. While Daddy is out Mummy Pig, Peppa and George make a chocolate birthday cake and prepare a "special birthday surprise". What can Daddys "special surprise" be?

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: The sly fox tries to take advantage of the animals on the farm being distracted whilst cheering on Shaun who was playing Bitzer in the greatest ping pong match ever.

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Evil Pea wears a giant powersuit so powerful it knocks Supertato across the supermarket aisles. Carrot and Supertato plan to outsmart Evil Pea so she will lose her new powers.

programme.title: Isadora Moon
programme.desc: When Isadora has to tidy her room, cousin Mirabelle comes up with a magical a potion creating three more Mirabelles to help.

programme.title: Super Monsters
programme.sub-title: Practice Makes Perfect / Henri In Boots
programme.desc: Lobos werewolf magic brings books to life, while Drac learns that practice makes perfect in a fun adventure filled with magic, teamwork, and growth.

programme.title: Mecha Builders
programme.desc: The "Pretty Big Thing" is scaring people from going to work. The Mechas must find out what it is!

programme.title: Octonauts And The Great Barrier Reef
programme.desc: In this musical special, the Octonauts must find a way to hold back hungry swarms of coral-eating starfish to save a new friends fragile reef home.

programme.title: Andy And The Band
programme.desc: Odd Sock Henny Feathers is an egg-centric farmer whose chickens arent laying eggs. Armed with costumes, mini-cameras and a Chicken Translator, Andy and the Band investigate.

programme.title: Play School Science Time
programme.desc: Can we make chalk from something found around the house or garden? Leah has run out of chalk to finish a game of hopscotch! But dont fret, Leah investigates how to make her own chalk using something commonly found at home.

programme.title: Vida The Vet
programme.desc: When Tidbit gets dehydrated, Vida helps him find a way to play AND hydrate at the same time.

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.sub-title: The Octonauts And The Adelie Penguins
programme.desc: While Kwazii and Peso have their hands full babysitting a bunch of Adelie penguin chicks, Captain Barnacles must rescue the chicks parents from a perilous sea storm!

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: Gekko tries to train a naughty monkey... and hide this from An Yu.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends: Big World! Big Adventures!
programme.desc: Its down to Darcy to rescue Monty when he falls down an old mine shaft.

programme.title: Odd Squad
programme.desc: Using the tip from Evil Sculptor, the Mobile Unit goes undercover as villains to catch the leader of the Villain Network. But first, they must go through a series of tests to prove they really are villains.

programme.title: Little J And Big Cuz
programme.desc: Big Cuz feels way too shy to dance in the school culture concert.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: The school roof is leaking so Mummy Pig does a parachute jump to raise money to fix it!

programme.title: Peter Rabbit
programme.sub-title: The Tale Of The One Who Got Away
programme.desc: When Peter and friends encounter the legendary Jack Sharp, a large trout that even Peters father failed to catch, they try to reel the fish in once and for all. But catching a fish is a lot harder than it looks.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Its time for a family game of hide and seek! Everyone hides, while Bluey counts to twenty, but will she be able to stay focused on the game and not get distracted by all her toys?

programme.title: Steve and Aneeshwar Go Wild
programme.desc: Steve and Aneeshwar meet a noisy sealion and see his swimming skills. They give some Capybara breakfast and find they have a surprising skill in common with the Sealion.

programme.title: In The Night Garden
programme.desc: Everything in the garden is so noisy that Igglepiggle moves away to find a quiet place to be by himself.

programme.title: Hoopla Doopla!
programme.desc: Squidgie has a bad cold and her sneezes and coughs sound like animal noises. Her friends think there are wild animals in her garden and try to rescue her.

programme.title: Daniel Tigers Neighbourhood
programme.desc: Daniel is excited to play at the playground, but first they need to go to the store to get new shoes for Margaret. It can be very hard to wait, but Daniel learns to sing and imagine to pass the time.

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing and Flop are in the park when they see Pando on a skateboard. Bing is full of awe as he watches Pando skate up and down and cant wait to have a go himself, but its much harder to balance than Pando made it look.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa is going for a sleepover at Zoe Zebras house with Suzy Sheep, Rebecca Rabbit, Candy Cat and Emily Elephant. The girls are too excited to sleep and stay up playing games and having fun until at last they feel sleepy.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: Shaun and the Flock decide to entertain one another with their best party tricks. Their fun is spoilt when the farmer decides that he wants to join in too.

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Evil Pea plunges Broccoli and Carrot into the doughnut toppings simultaneously, and Supertato almost quits being a superhero when he cant save his two friends at the same time.

programme.title: Isadora Moon
programme.desc: Isadoras excited for her first attempt at the traditional vampire family game, Catch That Fang, a chaotic flying pursuit of a golden fang.

programme.title: Super Monsters
programme.sub-title: Oh My, Pizza Pie / The Glorb Who Cried Werewolf
programme.desc: The Super Monsters use teamwork to help Chef Luigi deliver pizzas and learn a lesson about honesty when Glorbs pranks backfire, teaching them the importance of responsibility and trust.

programme.title: Mecha Builders
programme.desc: When super sticky slime spills on Zee and MacBarm, the Mechas have to figure out how to pull them apart.

programme.title: The Smeds And The Smoos
programme.desc: On a faraway planet, Janet and Bill meet in the Wurpular Wood and fall in love, but their families, The Smeds, and The Smoos cannot accept the match after generations of division.

programme.title: Maddie + Triggs
programme.desc: Triggs is finding it hard to get out of bed, and that pesky birdie outside his window is not helping; but Maddie soon helps him discover what the birdie is really singing about.

programme.title: Andy And The Band
programme.desc: Odd Sock Freddie cant do his homework because of his baby sister who constantly screams the house down, so Andy and the Band perform the ultimate lullaby to rock her to sleep.

programme.title: Play School Science Time
programme.desc: How does the harmonica make sound? Musician Colin Buchanan demonstrates the amazing instruments he can play and shows Teo how he can create his own harmonica to make music too!

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.desc: Cosima, Big Lizard and Ammon are squabbling over Dads precious Explorer Notebook. When disaster strikes, only by working together can they save it from being lost forever!

programme.title: Vida The Vet
programme.desc: Otto keeps getting a cramp while teaching dance class, so Vida teaches him to stretch!

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.sub-title: The Octonauts And The Great White Shark
programme.desc: Peso must perform an emergency fin bandage on a hungry great white shark, but first they need to subdue the giant predator using a trick called tonic immobility.

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: The PJ Maskss team spirt falls apart when Munki-gu sabotages their mission with "hilarious" pranks.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends: Big World! Big Adventures!
programme.desc: When Thomas loses his voice, he must find a new way to pass on a very important message.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Miss Rabbit spends the day picking people up and dropping people off in her job as taxi driver.

programme.title: Peter Rabbit
programme.sub-title: The Tale Of The Runaway Kites
programme.desc: Benjamins up in the air as the unwilling passenger of a flyaway kite! Can Peter and Lily put aside their differences and work together to rescue their friend?

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: While on a camping holiday, Bluey makes a new friend called Jean-Luc. Bluey may not understand him, but they find common language playing and hunting for a wild Daddy pig.

programme.title: Steve and Aneeshwar Go Wild
programme.desc: Steve and Aneeshwar drive through the baboons enclosure and say hello to some very mischievous baboons. They then meet the giant river otters and its feeding time.

programme.desc: Discover the wildest new music videos on rage. Essential grooves and boundary-pushing visuals from Australia and beyond.

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: Follow the latest on todays news, covering whats happening and why it matters. ABC News has reporters across Australia and around the globe to bring you the news you need to know. Presented by Craig Smart in Perth.

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: More news, more often. Wherever you are stay in touch with ABC News. Weve got more reporters in more places, connecting communities and covering the stories and issues that matter to you. Presented by Craig Smart.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: The World
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time to stay in touch with whats happening in our world. Manny Tsigas presents the latest international news from ABC News correspondents as well as interviews with experts and guests.

programme.title: Planet America: Weekend Edition
programme.desc: Zohran Mamdani wins the New York City mayoral race, Democrats win big in New Jersey and Virginia, California votes for Proposition 50 to redraw the congressional map. Chas and John discuss the fallout and what it means.

programme.title: Asia News Week
programme.desc: Yvonne Yong brings you a weekly roundup of the stories making news across the Asia region, plus whats trending on social media and making an impact on the culture and the way people live.

programme.title: That Pacific Sports Show
programme.desc: Its an all-female special on That Pacific Sports Show! Tiana and Sera celebrate women in sport with cricketer Melissa Velvel Fare and powerlifter Hani Watson.

programme.title: Weekend Breakfast
programme.desc: Start your weekend informed and up-to-date. Fauziah Ibrahim and Johanna Nicholson bring you the latest news, interviews, politics, culture, weather and global affairs. Plus sport with Daniela Intili.

programme.title: The World This Week
programme.desc: Girish Sawlani presents a roundup of the weeks big stories: Democratic socialist Zohran Mamdani elected mayor of New York City, fighting intensifies in the Ukrainian city of Pokrovsk, and David Beckham receives a knighthood.

programme.title: ABC News Regional
programme.desc: Growers call for people to buy local as the big supermarkets look overseas for produce, another big cleanup for southern Queensland as storms batter the region, plus forget Flemington - the Top End has the croc cup.

programme.title: The Breakfast Couch
programme.desc: Bridget, James, Emma and the team chat with former New Zealand Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern, ex Spice Girl Mel C, the stars of new series NCIS: Tony and Ziva, plus movie critic Zak Hepburn and former MasterChef Nat Thaipun.

programme.title: Stateline
programme.desc: A push for NSW Police and government to change the way they deal with long-term missing persons cases. Plus South Australias coastal communities contemplate a very different summer, as the toxic algal bloom lingers.

programme.desc: Melissa Mackay presents the latest from ABC News on the weekend bringing you todays top stories and coverage of events as they unfold. Plus original reporting, analysis and updated news, sport, weather and information.

programme.desc: For the latest news as it happens ABC News is the home of breaking news, compelling stories and Australias best investigative journalism. Round the clock coverage of the news that matters to you from the team you can trust.

programme.title: ABC National News
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time for transparency and trust. ABC News brings you the days top stories and latest news with more reporters to tell you whats going on and why it matters. Presented by Mariam Saab.

programme.title: ABC News Tonight
programme.desc: Mariam Saab brings you the latest headlines and a brief summary of the days top stories from ABC News.

programme.title: ABC Nightly News

programme.desc: When you need to know whats happening turn to ABC News for coverage you can trust. We bring you the days events from reporters across Australia, connecting communities and telling your stories. Presented by Mariam Saab.

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: Live across Australia, the latest headlines and the days top stories from ABC News. We have reporters on the ground connecting communities, telling your stories and bringing you coverage of whats happening as it unfolds.

programme.desc: The final word on the days top stories, with the latest news and updated information from Australias most trusted source of independent news. Presented by Mariam Saab.

programme.title: Asia News Week
programme.desc: Join Yvonne Yong for the news from Asia: Dozens killed after Typhoon Kalmaegi lashes the Philippines and Vietnam, Chinese retailer Shein sparks outrage opening a store in Paris, plus why Japan faces a surge in bear attacks.

programme.title: If Youre Listening
programme.desc: The tech bros are spending big to render AI an irreplaceable part of our everyday lives. Millions of people are already using AI every day, but is a world with widely available AI actually sustainable?

programme.desc: The headlines from ABC News, updating you on the days top stories from across Australia and around the world.

programme.title: ABC News With Auslan
programme.desc: The latest news and information from ABC News. This bulletin will be Auslan interpreted to provide accessible information to keep Australias deaf community connected and informed. Presented by Melissa Mackay.

programme.title: ABC Evening News
programme.desc: For the latest news as it happens ABC News is the home of breaking news, compelling stories and Australias best investigative journalism. Round the clock coverage of the news that matters to you from the team you can trust.

programme.title: ABC National News
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time for transparency and trust. ABC News brings you the days top stories and latest news with more reporters to tell you whats going on and why it matters. Presented by Meredith Sheehan.

programme.title: Whitlam Dismissal: 50 Years
programme.desc: The dismissal of an elected Australian Government has only happened once. 50 years since Sir John Kerr sensationally sacked PM Gough Whitlam, Greg Jennett looks at the legacy of the historic event and how it shaped democracy.

programme.title: ABC Late News Weekend
programme.desc: When you need to know whats happening turn to ABC News for coverage you can trust. We bring you todays events from reporters across Australia, connecting communities and telling your stories. Presented by Meredith Sheehan.

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: Live across Australia, the latest headlines and the days top stories from ABC News. We have reporters on the ground connecting communities, telling your stories and bringing you coverage of whats happening as it unfolds.
